name: Outline As Content (List)
description: Quick list post to test audience interest before writing long-form. Uses one of the 10 Magical Ways (tips, stats, steps, lessons, benefits, reasons, mistakes, examples, questions, stories) as a numbered list.
use_when: Testing if a topic resonates before investing time in long-form
Want quick, skimmable content that delivers value fast
Building social proof through engagement data
Creating content in 5 minutes instead of 50

hook.format: Number + Type + Topic (e.g., '5 financing mistakes first-time rental investors make:')
hook.purpose: Promise specific value in a scannable format
examples: 7 steps to buy your first rental property:
3 stats that prove why founders should write daily:
5 mistakes SaaS founders make with their first hire:

list_items.format: Numbered, one clear point per line
guidelines: Each item = one complete, actionable idea
Front-load the insight (don't bury the value)

examples: Which one have you seen (or made) before?
Which one are you working on right now?
What would you add to this list?

magical_ways.stories: X stories that changed how I [behavior]

quality_criteria.description: Each list item is concrete and specific, not vague
Can extract all value by skimming list in 15 seconds
Hook promises X items, body delivers exactly X items

forbidden_patterns: Don't write paragraphs - this is a LIST format
Don't deliver fewer items than promised in hook
Don't use vague items like 'be authentic' or 'work hard'
Don't skip the engagement question at the end
examples:
5 financing mistakes that kill first-time rental deals:

1. Not getting pre-approved before house hunting
2. Using personal credit cards for down payments
3. Ignoring the 1% rule completely
4. Skipping the property inspection to save money
5. Not calculating all carrying costs upfront

Which one have you seen (or made) before?
agent_instructions: Use company_documents and brand voice to determine: 1) Which 'magical way' fits the topic (mistakes? tips? steps?), 2) What specific audience archetype to target, 3) What sub-topic variation to explore. DO NOT ask user for these - infer from context and brand positioning.
